intro: Alloplectus tucurriquensis, commonly known as the Tucurriquén arrowhead, is a flowering plant native to parts of South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants commonly known as buckwheats. The plant is characterized by its distinctive arrowhead-shaped leaves and clusters of small, greenish-white flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as along stream banks or in wetlands. Alloplectus tucurriquensis is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological role in supporting local wildlife.
